name: anoxia
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
medical a serious condition in which there is little or no oxygen available to the blood and body: The baby had severe brain damage due to anoxia. Anoxia can occur during any operation involving anaesthesia. Compare
hypoxia
biology, chemistry, environment a lack of oxygen in a place or environment: Widespread ocean anoxia can suffocate oxygen-dependent marine life. They examined the effects of anoxia on the growth and survival of rice plants.
More examplesFewer examplesIf a patient suffers cardiac arrest outside a hospital they may die as a consequence of prolonged anoxia.Accidents involving carbon monoxide poisoning or anoxia will be investigated by a pathologist.In this dead zone of the bay, the water contains 0.2 mg/litre or less of oxygen, a state called "anoxia".
